Articles.Content:
QUESTION: 

KSP loading wrong resolution

 

SYSTEM SPECS:

  • Mac OS X
  • v10.10.5

 

  • KSP 64bit
  • v1.1.2
  • Steam

 

EXPLANATION:

When I adjust the 'Screen Resolution' setting, KSP scales everything down but does not make it higher res.

How can I get KSP to load in a higher resolution?

 

SCREENSHOT:

As you can see if you zoom in, the image is a 2560px screenshot of a 1280px game.

 

KSP SETTINGS FILE:

Edited June 6, 2016 by Osmium
Please see this thread.

Supersize screenshot affects the resolution of the screenshots. Is that what you are looking for?

From your description, it sounds more like you need to adjust the UI Scale (which is on that screen you have posted). That will increase the size of the text and such.

If neither of those is what you mean, then as sal_vager said, please provide a bit more info for us to help.

EDIT: Main Post professional-ized

Edited June 6, 2016 by Osmium

4 hours ago, Claw said:

Supersize screenshot affects the resolution of the screenshots. Is that what you are looking for?

From your description, it sounds more like you need to adjust the UI Scale (which is on that screen you have posted). That will increase the size of the text and such.

If neither of those is what you mean, then as sal_vager said, please provide a bit more info for us to help.

Thanks for the quick answer! 

For more clarification: My settings file is set to 2560p, but my game only gives me 1280p.

Edited June 6, 2016 by Osmium

Hi @cy4n, in your KSP folder there will be a KSP.log file, and there is a Player.log in the Library.

Quote

Mac OSX: Open Console, on the left side of the window there is a menu that says 'files'. Scroll down the list and find the Unity drop down, under Unity there will be Player.log Aka Files>~/Library/Logs/Unity/Player.log

We will need these files to see what KSP is doing, plus the hardware specifications of your computer, thank you.
